title: "What is the Symbolic Meaning of the Cube in Understanding the Visible and Invisible World?"
first_phrase: In this text, the author discusses the unique and visible nature represented by the intersection of two diagonals, which signifies the human nature of the mind as a spirit. The text then delves into the derivations of hieroglyphics, and the two spiritual phases of the psyche towards superior and parallel worlds. The last 200 tokens explore the symbol of complete universal existence, formed by a cube with six square faces. The cube represents the virtue in every manifestation and complexity, making it impossible for the profane eye to fully comprehend. The text explains how the diverse meanings assigned to sensory objects are not physical, but rather representations of the creation's act of virtue, which is the exception to its own power. The author also explores the concept of the first principle of virtue, which is represented by a point that emanates four opposing and harmonious bundles of force and light. The external symbol of the temple is represented by a luminous solar circle with four harmoniously projected beams of light.
content: 3) Le significazioni diverse che alle cose sensibili si appropriano non sono delle cose, ma della Virtù' dell'atto di creazione la quale Virtù' siccome e' causa, Origine e Fine di se stessa, rappresenta la eccezione della sua Potestà'. Solo il Primo Principio della Virtù' espressa nel quadrato e' per se stessa creatore e creatura, quindi Essenza perfetta per proprietà' di esistenza. Questa Virtù' Ente primitiva, padre e generatore di se stesso, e' rappresentato nella simbolica magica da un punto • il quale e' il centro delle due oblique del quadrato , ciò' che vuole indicare con geometrica precisione che ogni centro di creazione e' emanatore di quattro fasci di forza e di luce opposti ed armonici e nella simbolica esteriore del tempio, cangiando il punto in un circolo solare o luminoso, si esprime l'universo visibile con un cerchio con quattro fasci di luce proiettati armonicamente .
last_phrase: In conclusion, the symbol of the square and cube represents the pure and primary Virtue of creation, which emanates from an invisible center of force and light. This understanding provides insight into the two human conceptions of the First Virtue, one symbolized by the visible universe and the other by the invisible governor. The different meanings we assign to sensory objects are not themselves things, but rather the power of creation. The opposite qualities of light and darkness give meaning to one another.
